lines.text: If he's cursing on TV, then, he's tight.
Come on boys, pull daddy like a chariot.
This is straight out of a Hitchcock movie. I think I'm feeling vertigo.
Hold your head up, 'cause you got that double-chin thing going on.
Fuck you! Fuck you! Fuck you! Fuck you!
Nobody talks to me that way! NOBODY!
I do!
That turns me on!
Can I get a "ouch, that hurts"?
I am full of de facto, habeas corpus, and Emancipation Proclamation. Most important, I have a very big pro bono.
Massaging you is like kneading dough. And as for the sex, let me be honest. It's like sleeping with a damp sheep!
Very hip. Very cool. Very Vegas in the sixties.

[as sheik]
He says with that price, camel can dance up pyramid. It loses in translation.
Max, you may be a butthole, but you're my butthole.
I robbed a thief! How can you not see the humor in that?
Tread a level course.
What did the Boston Times call me?
The Dark Prince of Plunder.
Sell the house!
Up yours, you fat pig!
Why is it that every time Kevin's in trouble, we drop our things, but when I want help, you act like you're through a tunnel and can't hear me?
Maybe because I *like* Kevin!
Total stranger. Très bizarre.
Scandal and disease, Max.

[when asked if he can find Max]
Piece of cake. It's no harder than shutting down AOL for an hour. Not that I'd have any interest.
It kills me. The leave the light on trick.
Why don't they just put a sign saying welcome burglers no one home?
You ever read the papers?
I used to, but the news kept changing.
[watching as Max makes a fool of himself on TV]
Now this is entertainment!
